Villupuram is located at the heart of tamilnadu connecting chennai with the other southern districts in Tamilnadu.NH 45 which connects Chennai and Theni passes through Villupuram. Villupuram Bus stand is the largest Bus stand than any District bus stand in TamilNadu.  Combined Judiciory building is adjacent to Bus stand. District Collectorate Building also located near about 400 feet from Bus Stand.

Villupuram boasts of a junction which connects it with almost all the cities in south and Chennai. Most of the southern railway trains towards south(Madurai,cape) have to go via Villupuram, also all trains to Trichy,Dindugal, Madurai, Tirunelveli, Kanniyakumari, Cuddalore, Chidmbar am, kumbakkonam, Salem will stop in Villupuram railway junction for approximately 5 mins[ including superfast express trains]
Laksha deepam is a famous event which takes place once in a year at villupuram brings in huge crowds.

Laksha Deepam [-means Millions of Light in English] an Tamil new year event, usually people will say Chittirai Thirunal, Vishu will bring prosperous to everyone's life by blessings from Lord Almighty[Superior power irrespective of Religion].

Enormous amount of Please will Lighten Oil Lamp in a same place[In Anjaneyer/JaI BhajrangBali Temple]  -  by worshiping god to provode Health & Wealth to their Families and to bring Peace in the World.

Laksha Deepam in the month of April will be considered to be most famous event in every year in Villupuram, We will have many shops almost more than 200 shops will promote Books, House hold articles, utensils, Toys and Fancy items and fabrics , etc., which will help people to spend time by shopping houseticles at cheaper rates  during summer. Even childrens will have worthable leishure time to spare in their Summer vacation.  We can see all age group peoples at the same time in this place

Laksha Deepam [Millions of Light in English] is a Tamil new year event. Commonly known as Chittirai Thirunal, it is believed to bring prosperity to everyone's life by blessings from Lord Almighty[Superior power irrespective of Religion].
People gather to light oil lamps [In Anjaneyer/JaI BhajrangBali Temple] and pray for good health and wealth to their families and to bring peace in the world.
Laksha Deepam in the month of April is considered to be the most famous event of the year in Villupuram. It is the ideal time to shop for books, toys fabrics, utensils and household articles as hundreds of shops begin their summer sales.
Being a main junction and pass through town by road, it has lots of nice places to eat. Ponnusamy, Archana are few of those.
